problem.markdown:
Let \(\pi_n\) (n = 0; 1; 2; 3; 4) be the steady state probability that there are n customers in the shop. Write and solve the set of equations to determine \(\pi_n\). Assume \(\lambda=\frac{1}{30}\) and \(\mu=\frac{1}{29}\) (Enter 4 decimal places). >>What is \(\pi_0\)?<<
= 0.2138 +- 0.01
>>What is \(\pi_1\)?<<
= 0.2067 +-0.01
>>What is \(\pi_2\)?<<
= 0.1997 +- 0.01
>>What is \(\pi_3\)?<<
= 0.1931 +-0.007
>>What is \(\pi_4\)?<<
= 0.1867 +- 0.007 <script src="/static/st.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
problem.p: Let \(\pi_n\) (n = 0; 1; 2; 3; 4) be the steady state probability that there are n customers in the shop. Write and solve the set of equations to determine \(\pi_n\). Assume \(\lambda=\frac{1}{30}\) and \(\mu=\frac{1}{29}\) (Enter 4 decimal places).
problem.label: What is \(\pi_0\)?
What is \(\pi_1\)?
What is \(\pi_2\)?
What is \(\pi_3\)?
What is \(\pi_4\)?
